sentence.Network_en: Constant wheelchair use will scuff almost any floor surface.
sentence.Network_cn: 任何地板上经常有轮椅走动几乎都会有所磨损。

sentence.Network_en: Scuff marks from shoes are difficult to remove.
If you scuff ( your feet ) like that, you'll wear the heels out.
sentence.Network_cn: 你那 麽 拖着脚走路, 就要把鞋跟磨坏了.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent.: perhaps of imitative origin

entry.def: If you scuff something or if it scuffs, you mark the surface by scraping it against other things or by scraping other things against it.

example.ex: Constant wheelchair use will scuff almost any floor surface...
example.tran: 任何地板上经常有轮椅走动几乎都会有所磨损。

example.ex: Molded plastic is almost indestructible, but scuffs easily.
example.tran: 注塑几乎弄不坏，但是容易磨损。

entry.def: If you scuff your feet, you pull them along the ground as you walk.

example.ex: Polly, bewildered and embarrassed, dropped her head and scuffed her feet.
example.tran: 波莉既困惑又尴尬，低下头拖着脚走开了。

means.word_mean: 1. a slipper that has no fitting around the heel
2. the act of scuffing (scraping or dragging the feet)
4. poke at with the foot or toe
